Get in touch with UOW UOW Connect lets you know more about UOW with handful of information related to courses, staff, keydates and timetable Check which event is happening nearby If you are the type to go out and enjoy, this is the right place to check out some cool events happening around you. Unity - Games galore Unity really is fun. If you\'re looking to create some games, when you\'re not playing them, we have everything you need! Kotlin - The beautiful thing We all know Kotlin is just the best. Some might say that it\'s what programming languages should be. And they would be 100% korrect. Swift - The not so good Kotlin Swift is cool too. But not as cool as Kotlin, right? It\'s pretty similar to our beautiful, one of a kind, language, so you can learn it here as well. UOW Connect Open navigation drawer Close navigation drawer Android Studio android.studio@android.com Navigation header Settings Logout Starter Pack A guide for new students to set yourself up for the study ahead Hangouts Connect with fellow UOW students and explore with our chat service which connects you with current UOW students from a range of faculties and programs Discussion Forums> The student forum is a chance for students to engage with other students in a productive dialog that is focused on improving the student experience > The University of Wollongong was founded on the donations of local people who had a vision of a brighter future for our region. Since then, we have acted in partnership with our communities to not only make an impact in the Illawarra, but to address societyâ€™s critical economic, environmental, social and medical challenges. UOW is consistently ranked in the top 1% of universities in the world for the quality of our graduates.UOW graduates are well respected and are consistently ranked among the top one percent in the world by employers. We pride ourselves on preparing people for emerging industries and future jobs, people who are ready to succeed, and take their careers to the next level to make a positive contribution to their communities.
